markdownRemark.excerpt: In 2015, I started studying to become a software engineer. I just had my little daughter, so I tried to take a softer route. I did a postgraduate specialization…
markdownRemark.html:
In 2015, I started studying to become a software engineer. I just had my little daughter, so I tried to take a softer route. I did a postgraduate specialization in Brazil which covered basic subjects of computer science. Some courses that were handed out: computer organization, algorithms, java programming, software design, networks and databases. Meanwhile, I took HTML/CSS/vanilla-JS lessons on Codecademy. I finished this first part of my journey in May 2016. It was very introductory, and I didn’t get the level of knowledge and practice I wished.

Then I designed the curriculum I wanted to go through using course materials available online from top USA institutions. I put to myself a deadline to finish it in 18 months. Today there are some excellent resources available online, more optimized. The one I like the most and recommend is my friend P1xt’s Guides.

Here’s the road I took:

Subject Coursework Book used Project done
Months 1-2
Math for Computer Science MIT 6.001 Course notes
Computer Organization and Design Nand2Tetris Elements of Computing Systems: Build a computer from first principles
Months 3-4 -
Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs Berkeley CS61a Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
Algorithms and Data Structures Coursera/Princeton Algorithms (Sedgewick and Wayne)
Months 5-6
Programming Languages Univ. Washington / Coursera -
Operating Systems Berkeley CS162 Operating System Concepts (Silberschatz et al.)
UNIX Systems Berkeley CS9E Unix/Linux Ultimate Guide (Das)
Months 7-8
Databases EDX/Stanford Database Systems Concepts (Silberschatz et al.)
Networks Berkeley CS168 Computer Networking: Top-down approach (Kurose/Ross)
Months 9-10
Software Construction MIT 6.005 -
Computer System Security (MIT 6.858) MIT 6.858 -
Months 11-12
Full-stack Javascript development Node School -
Introduction to Artificial Intelligence Berkeley CS188 Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (Russell/Norvig)
Months 13-14
Distributed Systems MIT 6.824 Distributed Systems (A.Tanembaum et al.)
Machine Learning (Stanford/Coursera) Coursera

frontmatter.title: How I studied
frontmatter.description: How I studied programming and computer science curricula to become a software engineer
